did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection contains two screenplays written by Jay Allen Presson entitled The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie (1968) and Travels with My Aunt (1972).

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Jacqueline Presson was born in San Angelo, Texas, on 1922 March 3. She moved to Southern California in the early 1940s to pursue her dream of acting. She also married, but divorced after a number of years of marriage. After acting did not work out as a career, Presson transitioned to writing. She published her first novel, Spring Riot, in 1948.
Presson remarried in 1955 to Broadway reader Lewis Allen with whom she had a daughter, Brook. Due to a clerical error, Jacqueline began writing under the name Jay Presson Allen or simply Jay Allen.

Allen enjoyed Broadway and Hollywood success, particularly during the 1960s and 1970s. She earned a reputation for adapting novels to screenplays including The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie, Marnie, 40 Carats, and Travels with My Aunt. Her final screenplay, written in 1990, was a re-make of the literary classic Lord of the Flies.
Allen passed away in New York City on 2006 May 1. She was 84 years old.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection is arranged into a single series, I. Literary Productions, and contains two screenplays written by Jacqueline Presson (Jay Presson Allen) in 1968 and 1972. Both items are in good condition.

Based on the novel by Muriel Sparks, The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie was one of Jay Presson Allen’s most successful screenplays. It won acclaim in a variety of venues including the London theater (1966), Broadway (1968), and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Productions (1969). Esteemed actress Maggie Smith won an Academy Award for Best Actress for her portrayal of Jean Brodie, a teacher at an all girls’ school in Edinburgh during the 1930’s. The character runs into trouble when her idealistic views clash with the traditional curriculum supported by the school's administration.

Travels with My Aunt, a 1972 film based on the novel by Graham Green, enjoyed far less success. Actress Katherine Hepburn was initially part of the project, but she disliked Allen’s version of the screenplay. Maggie Smith ultimately played the lead role of Augusta Bertram, an eccentric woman who leads her nephew Henry Pulling on a number of comedic adventures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to this latest round of processing, the materials were housed in acid-free folders with no description or dates.
The collection has since been re-housed and described. The screenplays are now arranged into a single series, I. Literary Productions.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series I. Literary Productions, the only series in the collection, is comprised of two screenplays composed by Jay Presson Allen. The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie (1968) was produced by Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, while Travels with My Aunt (1972) was the property of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Inc. The materials in this series are in good condition, and all metal fasteners have been removed.
